oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mississippi Minstrels - 1949-06-10 - Part 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: CBS syndication of KMOX (St. Louis, IL) radio program Mississippi Minstrels, originally broadcast June 10, 1949, part 3. Featuring 'interlocutor' Lambert Kaiman; the Mississippi Minstrel Band directed by Professor Stanley Daugherty; comedians Harry Fender, and Mose (played by Al Bland); and musicians Charlie Ackerson, Jerry Whittington (name unconfirmed), and the Magnolia Quartet. Written and produced by Al Bland.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Magnolia Quartet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) The Magnolia Quartet [unconfirmed] performs "There'll Be A Hot Time In The Old Town Tonight" [incomplete] / (1:07) [Unidentified announcer] performs the closing statements with the closing theme playing underneath
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: CBS Inc.; KMOX (Radio station : Saint Louis, Mo.); Mississippi Minstrels (Radio program); Kaiman, Lambert; Ackerson, Charlie; Magnolia Quartet; Daugherty, Stanley; Mississippi Minstrel Band; Fender, Harry; Bland, Al
